lines.text: Isn't it just thrilling to graduate?
If a girl in my own class gives me her father's check for her and her brother, I have to believe it's good don't I? Unless you want me to have a suspicious nature.
Andrew Hardy, if you're going to make love to girls in the school building, kindly lower your voice so as not to set a bad example to the younger students!
I wasn't making love to Kathryn. Why that's the last thing in the world I'd think of doing is making love to Kathryn!
Oh thank you!
I didn't mean that that way...
Oh you didn't, did you?
Kathryn is my private secretary.
Private secretary - well that's a new one, isn't it?
Don't worry about Andrew and me, Polly. He's not my type.
Oh that's a fine thing to say about the president of the senior class.
All shades of silk stockings look pretty good to me.
I don't care what kind of clothes the ancient Greeks used to wear. I ain't gonna appear in public without any pants!
Jimmy McMahon, I'll have you know the ancient Greeks didn't even know what pants were.
Yeah well maybe the ancient Greeks weren't knock-kneed.
You know, you're kind of a new kind of girl to me.
Sometimes you folks from the other side of town give me a pain in the neck!
Going without a car is like going without knives and forks. It's like eating raw meat with your fingers!

[looks in the mirror and notices he has lipstick on his cheek]
No wonder Polly Benedict called me a bigamist.
Bigamist? Isn't that, uh, Polly's lipstick?
I'd rather not explain. I'm as innocent as a newborn babe but I don't expect anybody to believe me.
For years I've been hearing about the advantages of being eighteen. Now I might as well be living in the Dark Ages.
The classmate committee reports they can't make a statue of the goddess of grief out of chicken wire and plaster of Paris.
Hmm... Joe Costello's got some real marble statues over at his place right across from the cemetery.
Wouldn't it cost a lot to move one here?
Cost? Tell Joe Costello to deliver it free and we'll give him a free ad in the program. A lot of folks who'll be reading the program will be dead next year and they'll need monuments.
You're the swellest girl I ever met in my life. You're so swell that I never even once thought about trying to kiss you. That's the first time that ever happened to me in my life.
I'm the Greek god Apollo! You've gotta be a-scared of me!
